intro: Noccaea freynii, commonly known as the Freyn's bladder campion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves, adapted to thrive in dry, rocky environments. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in late summer. Noccaea freynii is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
